results.byline: By Damien Cave and Michelle Mishina Kunz
results.title: After Maui’s Wildfire Horror, Residents Search for a Way Forward
results.abstract: As the search effort continues more than a week after the disaster, Maui’s residents try to balance helping friends and families with the tourism work needed to support themselves.

media.caption: The beaches of Kihei and Wailea have been less crowded since the Lahaina wildfires. Life ticks on in the parts of Maui that were untouched by wildfire, and residents have tried to make sense of loss and death alongside life and tourism.

results.adx_keywords: Grain;Ports;International Relations;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);North Atlantic Treaty Organization;Black Sea;Danube River;Romania;Ukraine
results.title: As Russia Threatens Ships in the Black Sea, a Romanian Route Provides a Lifeline
results.abstract: A 40-mile channel, best known outside shipping circles as a magnet for bird watchers, is now a crucial route allowing Ukrainian grain to reach the sea, protected by a NATO umbrella.

media.caption: A ship at the Romanian port of Sulina, the main gateway to ports in the Danube River delta, this month. The nearby Sulina Channel has kept grain flowing since Russia started attacking Ukrainian ports.
media.copyright: Andreea Campeanu for The New York Times
